Description: Two textile fragments of undyed, medium-fine quality linen cloth. A is the main cloth; B is a small piece from another textile wrapped within A. A) rather open weave, undyed and now dark cream to tan in colour. Very worn; edges ragged. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.30 ends per 10mm and weft c.14 picks per 10mm. B) small, irregular fragment of fine linen, found wrapped within BM 6561a. Open weave; edged torn or ragged. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.23 ends per 10mm and weft c.19 picks per 10mm (splices few and far between).
